newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Clariant shareholders approve Hoechst deal.
newsitem.headline: Clariant shareholders approve Hoechst deal.

text.p: Swiss chemicals group Clariant AG said its shareholders voted by an overwhelming majority in favour of the incorporation of Hoechst AG's specialty chemicals business into Clariant.
Last December Hoechst agreed to sell its specialty chemicals business to Clariant and to retain a minority stake in the Swiss chemicals group.
The arrangement calls for Hoechst to receive 45 percent of Clariant's share capital, which will be increased to 727.2 million Swiss francs from 400 million.
This holding will represent less than 10 percent of Clariant's voting rights, Clariant said.
The Hoechst supervisory board approved the transaction on March 11. Hoechst shareholders will vote on the deal at their annual general meeting on May 6.
